Arabia Mountain by The Black Lips

Modern Art was the track that got me into The Black Lips

Completed.Title: Arabia Mountain
Completed.ReviewBody: We got another Black Lips album, right here. This is the album that introduced me to this band. _Modern Art_ specifically. This album marked a shift for the group towards a more surf rock sound, compared to their earlier garage rock aesthetic. While still having their garage roots, you can really hear the upgrade in production quality on this album. Most of the album is standout tracks, but _Modern Art_ is my favorite. Overall there isn't much to say, you kind of know exactly what you are getting with most of the tracks, but with an album like this that's kind of what you want anyway.

Wtf is melodic dubstep

Completed.Title: Arcadepunk
Completed.ReviewBody: This mini album was actually a bit of a surprise for me. I was not expecting to like it as much as I did. The sample work makes this feel glitchy in all the right places. _Scrapheap_ is just a touch to mellow for me, but other than that this entire album is pretty solid. _I'll wait_ uses a really gothic sounding keyboard that somehow feels right at home with the glitchy percussion. Overall this album is fifteen minutes long and definitely worth checking out.

Are You Dead Yet? by Children Of Bodom

Let's see what Melodic Death Metal has in store for me....

Completed.Title: Are You Dead Yet?
Completed.ReviewBody: Anyone remember Valarie Alfaro? because she is the one who recomended me this album. I think the thing I find most surprising about it, is that I still like it all these years later. The album starts out on a really high note with _Living Dead Beat_. It has a really sick guitar solo that blends into a keyboard solo. That is something I find cool about this album. I was not expecting Keyboards in a Death Metal album. Despite what you all may think I don't actually listen to much metal that isn't also in some way progressive. So I think the most suprising thing to me about this album is just how melodic it actually is, sounds obvious with the genre being Melodic Death Metal, but considering some of the other death metal I have listened to, it suprised me. The titular track, _Are You Dead Yet?_ is a good example of this, it has a full on chorus that would feel welcome in any Avenged Sevenfold album. The guitar solo on _If You Want Peace... Prepare for War_ is fucking awesome, you should listen to this album solely for that. Overall this was such a surprising album, but I loved it for it. If you are even slightly tempted by anything I wrote, I think you should go for it, you might surprise yourself.
TrackList: If You Want Peace... Prepare for War
Somebody Put Something in My Drink
Completed.Blurb: Let's see what Melodic Death Metal has in store for me....

Around the Fur by Deftones

Lmao I had this as a cd and I made my Mom listen to it for like 3 days straight when we drove to Tennessee one time.

Completed.Title: Around the Fur
Completed.ReviewBody: What a great album. I probably haven't listened to it in forever, but I still know most of the songs so well. This album is definitely aggro teenager music. The first track _My Own Summer..._ really sets that point, and sets it hard. While the album on the whole is pretty faced paced and aggressive, it has moments of calm, with almost ballad like qualities. Such as _Mascara_. The real standout track for me on this album is: _Be Quiet adn Drive (Far Away)_. This song is what plays in my head whenever someone says "Deftones". Overall I like this album quite a bit, mainly for nostalgia reasons, but even so it's still a fun time.

The Art of Drowning by AFI

Need to make sure I get the rest of the tracks

Completed.Title: The Art of Drowning
Completed.ReviewBody: Going into this album, I knew AFi had punk roots from doing the other album reviews. I also knew they had some goth/emo from the obvious Decemberunderground. It was pretty neat to see the shift forming with this album. I had ofcourse heard some of the singles off of this album before, but before this review process I had never listened to this album in it's entirety. The songs generally follow the same structrue, with hardcore punk drums and a chorus. Nothing special but also consistant throughout the album, so you really know what you are getting. There is some breaks to go into the more emo/goth-y sound that they are transitioning to. Overall it's a really solid album, a little repetitive but still a ton of fun all the way through.

Completed.Title: The Artist in the Ambulance
Completed.ReviewBody: I was really excited to get to this album. I used to have part of this album on an Alarm playlist that would wake me up before school. I distinctly remember that weird whining sound that starts off _All That's Left_ being the first thing I heard in the morning for quite a while. This album fits very well into that mid 2000's kind of post-hardcore, kind of emo. This album in particular gives me _Story of the Year_ vibes, although I am almost pretty positive that, that came after this album. Overall this was a great blast from the past, can't wait to put it on a more consistant rotation.

I don't really remember this album, I listened to their earlier albums more

It also didn't help that compared to their earlier albums, this one is not quite as catchy. There are still a few standout tracks like _Blook on My Hands_ or _Empty with You_. In some places this album feels like a pop album, with some slight emo tendancies to it. Overall I think this album is ok. I much prefer their earlier work, but there is still some fun to be had here.

As Daylight Dies by Killswitch Engage

THIS IS MY CURSE!!!!!

Completed.Title: As Daylight Dies
Completed.ReviewBody: I always wanted to like Killswitch much more than I actually do like them. They have a really interesting mix of powerful vocals and growls (of which are more common to the genre). As you all might guess, _My Curse_ is the standout track on this album. Besides that track, everything else is fine. There's only a couple tracks that I outright dislike; _Holy Diver_ and _This Fire_. One of the reasons that I think Killswitch never fully sat with me is they feel a bit Hair Metal-y; they are definitely not hair metal, but inbetween the bits of metalcore I get that hair metal vibe. Overall I like the album, I don't think I'd really skip any track if it came on in a shuffle, but I'm going out of my way to listen to more of it.
Completed.Blurb: THIS IS MY CURSE!!!!!
Completed.NextUpText:
NEXT UP:

Ascendancy by Trivium

While not quite as good as their next album Shogun, this is still pretty solid

Completed.Title: Ascendancy
Completed.ReviewBody: This album has a really interesting mix of goth, thrash, and metalcore. While I like their follow up album, _Shogun_, better this album is still a favorite of mine. Unlike the previous review; for _As Daylight Dies_, when I think of metalcore, this is much more what I think of. One of the things that really draws me to Trivium is their technical guitar work and solos. Even on tracks that I might not have liked as much, _Drowned and Torn Asunder_ for example, were almost bumped up to a four strictly for the solo. The solo on _Like Light to the Flies_ is a big standout, blending quite technical riffs for the majorit of the track, into a driving solo that brings everything back to the chorus. My favorite track on the album is _Dying in Your Arms_. Overall if you are a fan of early Metallica or metalcore in general I think you would also love this album.
TrackList: Pull Harder on the String of Your Martyr
A Gunshot to the Head of Trepidation
Blinding Tears Will Break the Skies
Washing Away Me in the Tides
Completed.Blurb: While not quite as good as their next album Shogun, this is still pretty solid

Astro Coast by Surfer Blood

This album is solid, I haven't listened to it in years

Completed.Title: Astro Coast
Completed.ReviewBody: Now this album brings back some memories. I don't think I really got into surfer blood until around 2012, but this album was on repeat for me quite a bit at the time. The album is kind of a rocksteady take on surf rock, most songs are pretty laid back, but feature a nice groove that you can get into. The album is pretty strong all the way through, with _Twin Peaks_ being my favorite track, but kind of takes a small dip towards the end. It's not bad, just doesn't hit the highs that are set for most of the album. Overall I really like the album, it's got a few too many low points to make it really shine, but on the whole it is definitely an album I can listen to almost whenver I want to.
Completed.Blurb: This album is solid, I haven't listened to it in years

Astro Lounge by Smash Mouth

SOME BODY, ONCE TOLD ME

Completed.Title: Astro Lounge
Completed.ReviewBody: I was wondering when _All Star_ would show up in the album reviews. I'll be honest I've never actually listened to this album all the way through before, in fact I don't know if I have even heard any track on here that wasn't _All Star_. Ofcourse that is the best song on this album but I was pleasently surprised by it anyway. It's not quite as good as _Fush Yu Mang_ but it's still pretty good. The album starts off a bit slow for me, with _I Just Wanna See_ and _Waste_ being two tracks that I just can't stand. _I Just Wanna See_ is atleast listenable, but _Waste_ is just so slow and boring and not at all what I am looking for in Ska album. Now I don't think anymore needs to be said about _All Star_, everyone knows this song and everyone loves this song, and anybody who says otherwise is just lying (Looking at you Pat). _Satalite_ was big surprise for me, while being a bit slower, it's got such a nice groove to it, it's quite a fun track. When _Radio_ came on I had to double check that I hadn't switched to a _Wavves_ track. It has that upbeat surf-rock - surf-punk vibe to it, unfortunately the chorus really kills this song for me, a bit too poppy; the only thing holding it back from a much higher score really. _Then the Morning Comes_ is so good, minus that way too pop-y chorus. It's really a shame since I do really like the track quite a bit until the chorus hits. Wow the middle of this album is quite a slog luckily it picks back up starting with _Defeat You_. Overall this album is a lot more fun than I thought it was going to be, there are some genuinely good tracks that are ruined by going a little to on the pop side.
TrackList: Can't get Enough of You Baby
Completed.Blurb: SOME BODY, ONCE TOLD ME

Completed.Title: After The Party
Completed.ReviewBody: This album came out a couple years after _Rented World_, and I had some high expectations for it. I can't say it totally lived up to them, but I think it's still pretty solid. The album starts out really strong with the track _Telling' Lies_. _Midwestern States_ is the next biggest highlight for me, after that. The album starts out pretty solid but it does start to dip after _Black Mass_, which I just can't stand, but it wouldn't be a Menzingers album without the required slow song. The only exception to the bad second half is _Bad Catholics_. Overall this album is pretty good, it has a few low points, but on the whole it's quite enjoyable.

Attack On Memory by Cloud Nothings

Holy shit this album is fucking fantastic, and I haven't listened to it in forever

Completed.Title: Attack On Memory
Completed.ReviewBody: I was so excited when I rememebered that this album was coming up fairly early on in the rating adventure. This album marked a drastic shift for Cloud Nothings. Previously they were a bit of a shoegaze-y, indie kind of band; but this album shifted them directly in Noise Rock and Post-Hardcore. The album starts with a nice building track, _No Future No Past_, which I really like but I don't feel like it hits the same in isolation that it does when it leads into _Wasted Days_. Speaking of, the song is so good I wish I could give it six stars. It's actually so good I want to lower the ratings of the other songs just so this one sits higher. _Fall In_ brings back a touch of the old style energy, but keeps the high energy they are cultivating on this album. With _Stay Useless_ we fully pick back up to the tone set in _Wasted Days_. _No Sentiment_ is probably the most similar to their old stuff, but it somehow works well in the larger context of the album. Overall this is a fantastic album, I am shocked everytime I finish it to find out it's only thirty minutes long.
Completed.Blurb: Holy shit this album is fucking fantastic, and I haven't listened to it in forever
